data.description: We are PMG Named Ad Age Best Places to Work for 11 years in a row and Fast Company Best Workplaces for Innovators since 2022, PMG is a global independent marketing services and technology company that seeks to inspire people and brands that anything is possible. Driven by shared success, PMG leverages business strategy and transformation, creative, media, and insights—as well as its proprietary operating system, Alli—to deliver cutting-edge digital solutions and innovative media strategies. Our team comprises over 900 employees globally, and our work for ambitious brands like Apple, Nike, Sephora, Experian, Therabody, Best Western Hotels & Resorts, Creed Fragrances, BNY, Intuit, CKE Restaurants, Travelex, and Whole Foods spans 85+ countries.Who You’ll Be Working With At PMG, data isn’t just numbers - it’s the foundation of smarter strategies and meaningful connections for some of the world’s most iconic brands. As a Data & Analytics Intern, you’ll join a collaborative, supportive team of industry experts who are passionate about using data to solve complex problems, uncover actionable insights, and shape strategies that drive real business results. This internship is more than just hands-on training - it’s an opportunity to work on meaningful projects that impact leading brands, while gaining experience with tools like SQL, data visualization platforms, and PMG’s proprietary marketing intelligence platform, Alli. You’ll learn from mentors who care about your growth, explore how data powers marketing strategies, and build relationships with a team that values curiosity, collaboration, and innovation. At PMG, you’ll find a space to develop your skills, grow your career, and make an impact. What You’ll Be Doing Collaborate on projects to analyze and interpret data, generate actionable insights, and support decision-making for leading brands. Use data to craft compelling stories that shape client strategies and maximize results. Gain practical experience with tools like SQL and data visualization platforms, sharpening your ability to work with complex datasets. Learn from experienced PMG professionals who are invested in your development, providing mentorship and exposing you to career opportunities within the marketing technology landscape. What You Will Bring Current enrollment as a rising senior undergraduate or graduate student pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Marketing, Business, Data Analytics, Business Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field and seeking a Summer 2026 internship. Proficiency in Excel for data analysis, including pivot tables, charts, and creating reports. Foundational knowledge of SQL for querying and manipulating datasets. Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker Studio, or Power BI to present clear, actionable insights (bonus if experienced). Exposure to Google Analytics or other analytics platforms to track and interpret performance metrics. A strong analytical mindset, with a passion for solving problems and uncovering actionable insights from data. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into clear, concise narratives that stakeholders can understand and act on. A proactive, self-starter attitude, seeing challenges as opportunities and eagerness to learn and grow. Must be based in Dallas, TX, and available to work in-office 5 days a week (PMG cannot provide relocation assistance for this internship). Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States, as PMG cannot provide sponsorship for this role. #LI-ONSITEWhat We Offer Professional Development: Take advantage of our learning and development programs, mentorship opportunities, and career advancement support. Generous Time Off: Enjoy generous paid time off and holiday allowances to recharge and spend time with loved ones. Parental Leave: We provide paid parental leave to support your family during important life events. Retirement & Pension Plans: Plan for your future with competitive retirement or pension programs, including contribution matching. Fertility and Family Support: Access fertility benefits for all team members and their spouses. Healthcare: Coverage and support for everyday medical expenses and routine care, tailored by geography. Pet Insurance: Protect your pet's health and your finances. Lifestyle Spending Accounts: Enjoy 100% company-funded accounts to promote healthy habits and well-being. Commuter Benefits: Access support for travel and commuting needs, where available. Annual Bonus: All employees are eligible for an annual bonus. Volunteering Opportunities: Receive 8 give-back hours to volunteer in your local communities. AI Enterprise License: Access AI Enterprise accounts and participate in weekly AI training sessions to empower and ensure AI safety. Benefits vary by country, location, and geography to reflect local laws, norms, and expectations. What Sets Us Apart Being part of PMG means joining a company culture that’s unmatched in digital. We're dedicated to working hard to serve our employees and clients, delivering value, results, and innovation—which often requires true grit and agility. We believe in taking care of ourselves and each other to continuously improve in every way. In alignment with our core values to be inclusive and always change for the better, PMG is committed to creating a more diverse and inclusive culture, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We believe that we only change for the better by bringing diverse perspectives to our company. PMG recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
